Most of the more than 100 genetic loci associated with type II diabetes affect 
the function of pancreatic islets, which produce insulin. Susceptibility to type 
II diabetes (T2D) increases with obesity, such that T2D-associated genetic loci
operate under conditions of obesity. 
 (See [Keller, Mark P et al. “Genetic Drivers of Pancreatic Islet Function.” Genetics vol. 209,1 (2018): 335-356](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC5937189/).) 


![LOD plot for insulin area under the curve](../fig/insulin-auc-lod-plot.pdf)
